item.title: A script I made for the fun of it
item.dc:creator: @N4TH4N N4TH4N
item.description:
@N4TH4N wrote:

The way you would have to do is KeyDown and KeyUp the codes for alt+f4 while the desktop is set as the client. Next use GetClientDimensions then get the center of them and find the offset for the shutdown button, another way I believe is you can just type ‘S’ or ‘U’ (not sure) and it will shutdown.

Read full topic

item.title: A script I made for the fun of it
item.dc:creator: @shit shit
item.description:
@shit wrote:

Well i made a script that shuts doen your comp for you,now just hit play and leave your comp when you need to. ;D

[sup]{ // 1 1 @@ !!!
\ 1 1 @@ !
\ 1111111 11 !
// 1 1 11 !
// 1 1 11 ! }

program shutdown;

begin

PlaySound(‘C:\WINDOWS\Media\Windows XP Shutdown.wav’);
clickmouse(37,750,True)
wait(2000)
clickmouse(274,712,True)
wait(5000)
clickmouse(507,280,True)
end.[/sup]

Read full topic
item.source: A script I made for the fun of it
